content: I am unclear on what you are reporting. You state the PC crashed before the problem, yet also state that Thunderbird was updating during the crash. A crash may have destroyed the profile. Did you have to restore Windows after the crash? Did you restore Thunderbird? Have you logged onto the account online to see if the messages are there? Is the account IMAP or POP? Please share more information, and we will offer whatever assistance we can. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
1. The Message List Pane only displays emails within the folder itself, not emails in the subfolders.

2. I recommend using a saved search. The following link may be helpful: Using Saved Searches https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/using-saved-searches

Click the "Choose..." button, and then select the folders you want to include in the search.

Select "Match all messages" as your search criteria.
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content:
To assist, it is important that we see what you're seeing. To do that, please post screenshots of - the error message - the 'account setting' pane of an account, the one showing 'outgoing server' on bottom line - the SMTP server settings pane for that account - the pane that lists all SMTP servers

Seeing that will help. Thank you.
creator: davidsk
